result.execSummary:
The defendant Xavier J Brooks was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Fail/Comply-Officer/Person into Custody, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.415(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Sentence credit of 3 days granted, if revoked.

miscConds.notes: Maintain absolute sobriety. Comply with random urine screens. No Use or Possession of alcohol while underage, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia. No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.

Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.

No VIOLENT contact with:  victim/witness listed in the criminal complaint.

Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.

No possession of any dangerous weapons.

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment. 

Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all restitution/costs/fees, and no new law violations. If the Defendant violates any terms of his/her probation, or has any condition time imposed, the Court will deem that the conditions precedent necessary for the conditional grant of Expunction have not been met and therefore Expunction is denied. The defendant shall file a petition with the Court to verify the successful completion of the sentence.
Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

records.addlTxt:
11:17 AM Defendant Xavier J Brooks in court.  Attorney Christopher Scott Carson in court for Xavier J Brooks.  Prosecuting attorney Peter Michael Tempelis in court for the State of Wisconsin. Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 
Court conducts a plea colloquy with defendant. 
Defendant enters a plea of guilty to Count 1.
Court finds the defendant guilty to Count 1. 
Court dismisses and reads in Counts 2, 3, 4, 5, 6 and 7.

Court orders the following:
Withhold
3 Days credit if revoked
STAYED for PROBATION

Term of Probation: 18 MONTHS
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
 Absolute Sobriety; Random U.A.'s ; 
 No Use or Possession of alcohol while underage, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
 No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
 Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent; 
 Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
 No possession of any dangerous weapons
 No VIOLENT contact with:  victim/witness listed in the criminal complaint
 DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.

COSTS:  $268.00
DNA SAMPLE AND SURCHARGE:  $250.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation);
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.

Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all restitution/costs/fees, and no new law violations. If the Defendant violates any terms of his/her probation, or has any condition time imposed, the Court will deem that the conditions precedent necessary for the conditional grant of Expunction have not been met and therefore Expunction is denied. The defendant shall file a petition with the Court to verify the successful completion of the sentence.
